revision.text:
{{Distinguish|Kyle Walker-Peters}} {{Use British English|date=August 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Kyle Walker | image = Kyle Walker.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Walker during training with [[England national football team|England]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] | fullname = Kyle Andrew Walker<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|5|28|df=y}}<ref name=Hugman1011>{{cite book |editor-first=Barry J. |editor-last=Hugman |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 |year=2010 |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |location=Edinburgh |isbn=978-1-84596-601-0 |page=426}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Sheffield]], England | height = {{convert|1.78|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/kyle-walker/68532/ |title=K. Walker: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=15 May 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Right back]] | currentclub = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | clubnumber = 2 | youthyears1 = 1997–2008 | youthclubs1 = [[Sheffield United F.C. Academy|Sheffield United]] | years1 = 2008–2009 | clubs1 = [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] | caps1 = 2 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2008 | clubs2 = → [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]] (loan) | caps2 = 9 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2009–2017 | clubs3 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps3 = 183 | goals3 = 4 | years4 = 2009–2010 | clubs4 = → [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] (loan) | caps4 = 26 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2010–2011 | clubs5 = → [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] (loan) | caps5 = 20 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2011 | clubs6 = → [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] (loan) | caps6 = 15 | goals6 = 1 | years7 = 2017– | clubs7 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps7 = 54 | goals7 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2009 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 7 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 7 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2011– | nationalteam3 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps3 = 44 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | club-update = 10:33, 7 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 00:10, 5 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Kyle Andrew Walker''' (born 28 May 1990) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[right back]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
==Early life== Walker was born in [[Sheffield]], South Yorkshire<ref name=Hugman1011/> to an English mother and Jamaican father.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/06/09/euro-2016-one-in-three-players-could-play-for-another-country/ |title=One in three players at Euro 2016 could play for another country}}</ref> He grew up on a council estate in the [[Sharrow]] area of the city<ref name="telegraph-ambassador">{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/tottenham-hotspur/8799568/Tottenham-Hotspur-v-Arsenal-Kyle-Walker-the-perfect-ambassador-for-Spurss-work-in-the-community.html |title=Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal: Kyle Walker the perfect ambassador for Spurs's work in the community |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |first=Duncan |last=White |date=1 October 2011 |accessdate=4 May 2017}}</ref> and attended Porter Croft Infant & Junior School, followed by [[High Storrs School]] until 2006.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thestar.co.uk/news/education/social-media-spells-end-of-sheffield-school-old-boys-social-club-1-6897306 |newspaper=The Star |location=Sheffield |title=Social media spells end of Sheffield school old boys' social club |date=16 October 2014 |accessdate=7 March 2017}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Sheffield United=== Walker joined boyhood club [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]],<ref name=es>{{cite news |title=My dad was petrified I'd get killed on the M1, so I had to follow him to Northampton, says Kyle Walker |url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/standard-sport/football/article-24011485-my-dad-was-petrified-id-get-killed-on-the-m1-so-i-had-to-follow-him-to-northampton-says-kyle-walker.do |newspaper=London Evening Standard |accessdate=18 November 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111119233404/http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/standard-sport/football/article-24011485-my-dad-was-petrified-id-get-killed-on-the-m1-so-i-had-to-follow-him-to-northampton-says-kyle-walker.do |archivedate=19 November 2011 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> at the age of seven after being recommended by coach Paul Archer at [[Football Unites, Racism Divides]] and progressed through the ranks to become a regular fixture in the reserves by 2008.<ref name="telegraph-ambassador"/> In November 2008, he was allowed to join [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]] on a one-month [[Loan (sports)|loan]] to gain first team experience,<ref name="Northampton loan">{{cite web |title=Walker on the move |url=http://origin-www.sufc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10418~1453606,00.html |publisher=Sheffield United F.C. |date=13 November 2008 |accessdate=24 November 2008}}</ref> making his debut on 15 November 2008 in a defeat by [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]].<ref name="Northampton debut">{{cite web |title=Gray upset by defeat |url=http://www.ntfc.co.uk/page/MatchReaction/0,,10425~1435139,00.html |publisher=Northampton Town F.C. |date=16 November 2008 |accessdate=22 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120902102105/http://www.ntfc.co.uk/page/MatchReaction/0%2C%2C10425~1435139%2C00.html |archivedate=2 September 2012}}</ref> His one-month loan was later extended into January,<ref name="Northampton loan extended">{{cite web |title=Kyle extends loan |url=http://www.ntfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10425~1494573,00.html |publisher=Northampton Town F.C. |date=22 December 2008 |accessdate=22 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120902102119/http://www.ntfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10425~1494573%2C00.html |archivedate=2 September 2012}}</ref> before eventually returned to Bramall Lane having played nine matches for the Cobblers.<ref>{{cite web |title=Walker returns to parent club |url=http://www.ntfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10425~1501496,00.html |publisher=Northampton Town F.C. |date=28 December 2008 |accessdate=29 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090817205302/http://www.ntfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10425~1501496%2C00.html |archivedate=17 August 2009}}</ref>
Soon after returning to his parent club, Walker made his full debut for Sheffield United on 13 January 2009, starting in a third round [[FA Cup]] tie against [[Leyton Orient F.C.|Leyton Orient]].<ref name="blades debut"> {{cite web |title=Progress – On two fronts |url=http://origin-www.sufc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/Gaffersnotes/0,,10418~1520011,00.html |publisher=Sheffield United F.C. |date=14 January 2009 |accessdate=14 January 2009}}</ref> With the Blades losing a number of players to injury in the closing weeks of the season, Walker was a surprise inclusion in the starting line up for the crucial last two matches of the season, making his full league debut for the club on 25 April 2009 against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref name="blades league debut">{{cite news |title=No qualms over role for Walker |url=http://www.thestar.co.uk/sport/sheffield-united/No-qualms-over-role-for.5211246.jp |newspaper=The Star |location=Sheffield |date=28 April 2009 |accessdate=4 June 2009}}</ref> After two outstanding performances he retained his place as Sheffield United entered the play–offs, starting both matches against [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] and the final against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] at the end of May.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} By playing in the final, Walker became the youngest Sheffield United player ever to play at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref name="Wembley Record">{{cite web |title=Kyle, the younger, steals record |url=http://origin-www.sufc.co.uk/page/PlayerFeatures/0,,10418~1685649,00.html |publisher=Sheffield United F.C. |date=3 June 2009 |accessdate=3 June 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130605122652/http://origin-www.sufc.co.uk/page/PlayerFeatures/0,,10418~1685649,00.html |archivedate=5 June 2013}}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== On 22 July 2009, Walker left Sheffield United to join [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] along with fellow defender [[Kyle Naughton]] for a combined fee of £9 million, but was loaned back to United for the duration of the 2009–10 season as part of the deal.<ref name="spurs transfer">{{cite news |title=Spurs capture Naughton and Walker |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sheff_utd/8144711.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 July 2009 |accessdate=22 July 2009}}</ref> While at [[Bramall Lane]] he was virtually ever present at right back for the first half of the season but was unexpectedly recalled back to Spurs on 1 February 2010, just before the close of the January 2010 [[transfer window]], as cover for [[Alan Hutton]] who was loaned out to [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] earlier the same day.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tottenham Hotspur recall Sheffield United's Walker |url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/sport/Tottenham-Hotspur-recall-Sheffield-United39s.6034450.jp |newspaper=The Yorkshire Post |location=Leeds |date=2 January 2010 |accessdate=2 February 2010}}</ref> Walker made his debut for Tottenham on Saturday 27 March 2010, in a 2–0 victory over [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]].<ref name="spurs debut">{{cite news |title=Tottenham 2 Portsmouth 0: Peter Crouch and Niko Kranjcar pile on the pain for Pompey |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1261128/Tottenham-2-Portsmouth-0-Peter-Crouch-Niko-Kranjcar-pile-pain-Pompey.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=28 March 2010 |accessdate=28 March 2010 |location=London |first=Ian |last=Ridley}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref>
[[File:Kyle Walker Spurs USA tour 2010.jpg|thumb|upright|Walker with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in 2010]]
At the start of the following season, Walker went out on loan once more signing an initial six-month deal with [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] (QPR) due to injuries at the club in the right back position.<ref name="qpr loan">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/q/qpr/8995384.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |title=Spurs defender Walker joins QPR |date=13 September 2010 |accessdate=13 September 2010}}</ref> In mid-October, his loan was extended until 3 January 2011.<ref name="extended loan">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/q/qpr/9093535.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |title=QPR extend loan of Spurs' Walker |date=14 October 2010 |accessdate=14 October 2010}}</ref>
After he had left QPR, Walker joined [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on loan until the end of the [[2010–11 Premier League|2010–11]] season.<ref name="villa loan">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/aston_villa/9339872.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |title=Villa sign Spurs defender on loan |date=6 January 2011 |accessdate=6 January 2011}}</ref> He scored on his debut only nine minutes into the match against former club Sheffield United in the third round of the FA Cup in January 2011.<ref name="fa cup goal">{{cite news |title=A Houl lot of relief at Bramall Lane |url=http://www.people.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/fa-cup-match-reports/2011/01/09/sheffield-united-1-3-aston-villa-a-houl-lot-of-relief-at-bramall-lane-102039-22835698/ |newspaper=The Sunday People |location=London |date=9 January 2011 |accessdate=6 February 2011}}</ref> At the start of February, Walker scored his first Premier League goal and first senior league goal, a 30-yard strike low into the left corner against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref name="prem goal">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/9385528.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |title=Aston Villa 2–2 Fulham |date=5 February 2011 |accessdate=6 February 2011}}</ref> He returned to his parent club at the end of the 2010–11 season after scoring two goals in 18 appearances in all competitions for Aston Villa.
On leaving Villa Park, Walker suggested that he would be happy to return to the club the following season,<ref name="villa return">{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_6908583,00.html |publisher=Sky Sports |title=Walker hints at Villa stay |date=1 May 2011 |accessdate=4 July 2011}}</ref> as first team opportunities were limited<ref name="spurs options">{{cite news |url=http://www.tottenhamjournal.co.uk/tottenham-hotspur/tottenham-hotspur/ten_could_leave_spurs_as_club_plan_for_september_s_25_man_squad_1_903218 |newspaper=Tottenham Journal |title=Ten could leave Spurs as club plan for September's 25-man squad |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=4 July 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110528160305/http://www.tottenhamjournal.co.uk/tottenham-hotspur/tottenham-hotspur/ten_could_leave_spurs_as_club_plan_for_september_s_25_man_squad_1_903218 |archivedate=28 May 2011 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> but Tottenham Hotspur manager [[Harry Redknapp]] later stated that he did not wish to sell the defender.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} Walker subsequently agreed to a contract extension at Tottenham until 2016.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_6832368,00.html |publisher=Sky Sports |title=Redknapp will not sell Walker |date=24 March 2011 |accessdate=4 July 2011}}</ref> Walker was chosen in the starting eleven for Tottenham's opening match of the 2011–12 season, against Manchester United at Old Trafford on 22 August 2011.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/aug/22/manchester-united-tottenham-hotspur "Manchester United v Tottenham live match report"]. ''The Guardian''. London. Retrieved 22 August 2011.</ref> On 2 October, he scored the winning goal in the [[North London derby]] against Arsenal from 25-yards out. Tottenham won the match 2–1.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15051273 "Tottenham 2–1 Arsenal"]. BBC Sport. 2 October 2011. Retrieved 6 May 2012.</ref>
On 22 April 2012, Walker was named as the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]], beating the likes of [[Sergio Agüero]], [[Danny Welbeck]], [[Daniel Sturridge]], [[Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain]] and teammate [[Gareth Bale]] to the award, as well as being named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]].<ref name=PFA>{{cite news |title=Spurs defender Kyle Walker wins PFA Young Player award |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17734248 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 April 2012 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> On 29 April, he scored a free kick from 25 yards to help Tottenham beat [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] 2–0 at [[White Hart Lane]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17803505 "Tottenham 2–0 Blackburn"]. BBC Sport. 29 April 2012. Retrieved 6 May 2012.</ref> On 3 May 2012, Walker was awarded with a new five-year contract, that runs until 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/spurs/News/kyle-commits-to-new-deal-030512.page? |title=Kyle commits to new deal |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |accessdate=3 May 2012}}</ref>
Walker's performance against Manchester United in March 2012 saw him at fault for two of the opposition's goals in a 3–1 defeat.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He began his next season in a similar vein; he was at fault for Chelsea's 4th goal in the 4–2 defeat at White Hart Lane, getting shrugged off the ball easily by Juan Mata.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He was ever-present in the first half of the season in the Premier League, with the exception of the 3–0 victory over Fulham at Craven Cottage; this included playing 90 minutes in the 3–2 win over Manchester United, which was Tottenham's first victory at Old Trafford in 23 years.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}}
[[File:Kyle Walker 01-09-2013 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Walker playing for Tottenham Hotspur in 2013]]
On 28 October 2013, it was announced that Walker had signed a new contract with Tottenham, keeping him at the club until 2019.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/new-contract-for-walker-281013/ |title=New contract for Walker |date=28 October 2013 |accessdate=28 October 2013 |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C.}}</ref>
Walker was part of the team that lost 2–0 to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at Wembley Stadium in the [[2015 Football League Cup Final|2015 League Cup Final]] on 1 March.<ref name=2015LC>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Chelsea 2–0 Tottenham Hotspur |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31572594 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 March 2015 |accessdate=16 December 2017}}</ref>
On 8 August 2015, Walker was involved in an own goal which led to Tottenham suffering a defeat in the hands of Manchester United in the season opener and it also became the first goal of the [[2015-16 Premier League|new season]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Kyler Walker's own goal gives Manchester United the win in season opener |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744640 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=8 August 2015 |date=8 August 2015}}</ref>
On 20 April 2017, Walker was named as right-back in the PFA Team of the Year for the second time.<ref name=PFA1617>{{cite news |title=PFA teams of the year: Chelsea and Tottenham dominate Premier League XI |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39648483 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 April 2017 |accessdate=16 December 2017}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== On 14 July 2017, Walker signed a five-year contract with Tottenham's Premier League rivals [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]],<ref>{{cite web |title=City announce signing of Kyle Walker |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2017/july/kyle-walker-joins-city |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |date=14 July 2017 |accessdate=14 July 2017}}</ref> in a transfer reported to be worth an initial £45 million fee, rising to £50 million with add-ons, making it one of the [[List of most expensive association football transfers|most expensive football transfers]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Kyle Walker: Man City sign right-back from Tottenham for £45m plus add-ons |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40598351 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 July 2017 |accessdate=14 July 2017}}</ref>
He made his competitive debut for City against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton]] on 12 August 2017, a game where many media outlets labelled him as the best player.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester City player ratings: Kyle Walker the pick in a humdrum display |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-player-ratings-brighton-13468298 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=12 August 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=£50 million man Kyle Walker impresses in debut, City see off Brighton |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/club/manchester-city/382/blog/post/3178393/50-million-man-kyle-walker-impresses-in-debut-manchester-city-see-off-brighton |publisher=ESPN |date=12 August 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2017}}</ref> However, during Walker's home debut for Manchester City he was sent off for two yellow card offences against Everton, which was thought to be a harsh decision by referee [[Bobby Madley]].<ref>{{cite news |title=City 1–1 Everton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40920114 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 August 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2017}}</ref> Walker was selected and part of the squad that beat Arsenal 3–0 at Wembley Stadium in the [[2018 EFL Cup Final]] to claim his and City's first trophy of the 2017–18 season.<ref name=2018LC>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43101681 |title=Arsenal 0–3 Manchester City |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 February 2018 |accessdate=25 February 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Before having even made a league appearance for Sheffield United, Walker was called up to the [[England national under-19 football team|England U19s]] in February 2009.<ref name="england call up">{{cite web |title=Another young Blade earns England call |url=http://www.sufc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10418~1547871,00.html |publisher=Sheffield United F.C. |date=6 February 2009 |accessdate=11 February 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120806003532/http://www.sufc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10418~1547871,00.html |archivedate=6 August 2012 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made his début on 10 February, coming on as a second-half substitute in a 3–0 loss to [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain U19s]].<ref name="england début">{{cite web |title=The Kyles get international cameos |url=http://www.sufc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10418~1553137,00.html |publisher=Sheffield United F.C. |date=10 February 2009 |accessdate=11 February 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120805143858/http://www.sufc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10418~1553137,00.html |archivedate=5 August 2012 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Following his first run of regular Premier League starts, Walker was called up to the full [[England national football team|England]] squad in February 2011 and again in March 2011.<ref name="full england début">{{cite news |title=Fabio Capello calls up Kyle Walker for England friendly |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/9388124.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 February 2011 |accessdate=6 February 2011}}</ref> However, he did not feature in any of the matches played and pulled out of the squad in March due to an injury.{{cn|date=April 2017}}
At the end of the 2010–11 season, Walker was named as part of the England squad which competed in the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] competition in Denmark.<ref name="england u21">{{cite web |title=Squad numbers confirmed |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/mens-under-21s/News/2011/englnd-u21s-squad-numbers |publisher=The Football Association |date=7 June 2011 |accessdate=6 February 2011}}</ref> Despite the poor showing of the team who were knocked out in the first round, Walker was named in the Team of the Tournament.<ref name=TOTT>{{cite news |first=Jeremy |last=Wilson |title=Tottenham Hotspur defender Kyle Walker set to make England debut against Holland |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/england/8687776/Tottenham-Hotspur-defender-Kyle-Walker-set-to-make-England-debut-against-Holland.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=7 August 2011 |accessdate=16 December 2017}}</ref>
His good form in the 2011–12 [[Premier League]] season saw him named in the England squad for a friendly against [[Spain national football team|Spain]]. On 12 November, Walker made his England debut in the 1–0 win over Spain, coming on for [[Scott Parker]] as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in the 85th minute.<ref name="bbc15693231">{{cite news |title=International friendly: England 1–0 Spain |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15693231.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date=12 November 2011 |accessdate=13 November 2011}}</ref>
Walker went on to make his first start for England on 15 November, in a 1–0 win against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]], during which he won man-of-the-match.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15709627 "International friendly: England 1–0 Sweden"]. BBC Sport. 15 November 2011. Retrieved 3 March 2013.</ref> He missed [[UEFA Euro 2012]] because of a toe injury, suffered in a league match against Fulham.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18081125 "England Euro 2012 squad: Ruddy, Carroll & Defoe in, Ferdinand out"]. BBC Sport. 16 May 2012. Retrieved 3 March 2013.</ref>
Walker played the first England match after Euro 2012, playing the full 90 minutes of a 2–1 win against [[Italy national football team|Italy]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19238374 "England 2–1 Italy"]. BBC Sport. 15 August 2012. Retrieved 3 March 2013.</ref>
He was named in the 23-man [[England national football team|England national team]] squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref>
==Sponsorship== In December 2012, Walker signed a boot deal with [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]] to wear the T90 Laser IV which were also worn by [[Wayne Rooney]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.footballboots.co.uk/8325-kyle-walker-and-his-new-brand-nike.html |title=Kyle Walker and his new brand: Nike |publisher=FootballBoots.co.uk |accessdate=13 December 2012}}</ref> From 2009 to 2012, he wore the SX Valor, SX Flare, Stealth Pro, Speciali, Stealth Pro II, GT Pro, and GT Pro II boots by [[Umbro]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.soccerbible.com/boot-spotting/2012/12/kyle-walker-in-nike-switch-to-wear-t90/ |title=Kyle Walker in Nike Switch – To Wear T90 |date=12 December 2012 |website=soccerbible.com |accessdate=4 February 2017}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 6 February 2019}}
{| class=wikitable style=text-align:center |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|[[FA Cup]] !colspan=2|[[EFL Cup|League Cup]] !colspan=2|Europe !colspan=2|Other !colspan=2|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |[[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield ==Honours== '''Tottenham Hotspur''' *[[Football League Cup]] runner-up: [[2014–15 Football League Cup|2014–15]]<ref name=2015LC/>
'''Manchester City''' *[[Premier League]]: [[2017–18 Premier League|2017–18]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/3955/Kyle-Walker/overview |title=Kyle Walker: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=15 May 2018}}</ref> *[[EFL Cup]]: [[2017–18 EFL Cup|2017–18]],<ref name=2018LC/> [[2018–19 EFL Cup|2018–19]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47268861 |title=Chelsea 0–0 Manchester City |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 February 2019 |accessdate=24 February 2019}}</ref> *[[FA Community Shield]]: [[2018 FA Community Shield|2018]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44995783 |title=Chelsea 0–2 Manchester City |first=Chris |last=Bevan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 August 2018 |accessdate=7 August 2018}}</ref>
'''England''' *[[FIFA World Cup]] fourth place: [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44748604 |title=Belgium 2–0 England |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 July 2018 |accessdate=1 September 2018}}</ref>
'''Individual''' *[[UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] Team of the Tournament: [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship#Team of the Tournament|2011]]<ref name=TOTT/> *[[PFA Young Player of the Year]]: [[2011–12 Premier League#PFA Young Player of the Year|2011–12]]<ref name=PFA/> *[[PFA Team of the Year]]: [[PFA Team of the Year (2010s)#Premier League 3|2011–12 Premier League]],<ref name=PFA/> [[PFA Team of the Year (2010s)#Premier League 8|2016–17 Premier League]],<ref name=PFA1617/> [[PFA Team of the Year (2010s)#Premier League 9|2017–18 Premier League]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43810017 |title=Manchester City players dominate PFA team of the year |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 April 2018 |accessdate=5 May 2018}}</ref> *[[FIFPro World XI|FIFA FIFPro World XI]] 2nd team: 2018<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifpro.org/news/world-11-the-reserve-teams-for-2017-18/en/ |title=World 11: The Reserve Team for 2017-18 |publisher=FIFPro.org |date=24 September 2018 |accessdate=25 September 2018}}</ref>
